Agave Web Framework 1.0 API

Agave is a library designed to enable rapid web application development through the use of handlers that field HTTP requests.

See:
          Description

Packages
agave Serves as the main interface to Agave for a webapp developer, with the AgaveFilter serving as the Front Controller in a Model-View-Controller architecture, and several annotations to describe how handler methods will field HTTP requests.
agave.conversion A collection of default Converters that Agave uses to convert from String parameters to higher level objects.
agave.exception The exceptions that Agave supports.
agave.internal The internals of Agave.

 

Agave is a library designed to enable rapid web application development through the use of handlers that field HTTP requests. The handler methods are self-describing and need no more configuration information beyond the method-level annotations that identify handlers and indicate how to treat user input. During initialization of the context, the /WEB-INF/classes directory is scanned for all handlers and they are registered after they have been recognized.

This all happens with the classes and annotations from the agave package. The javadoc in that directory will serve as a good starting place for more information. Another point of interest will be the agave.conversion package, which will describe how form objects will have input converted from a string into a higher-order object.
